intro: Lippia controversa var. brevipedunculata, commonly known as the narrow peduncle lippia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, white to pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for xeriscaping in arid regions. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
